Definition: An expression of annoyance, frustration, or pain; an exclamation of discomfort. "Adoi" is believed to have originated from the Malay language, in which it means "ouch" or "oh no". It has since been adopted into Singlish and is commonly used to express discomfort or frustration. The pronunciation of "adoi" varies depending on the speaker's accent and emphasis. It can be pronounced with a long "a" sound (ah-doy) or a short "a" sound (uh-doy).
Example: 1. Adoi, this food is too spicy!
